headline.main: World Briefing | Africa: Angola: President Won't Meet Rebel Leader

lead_paragraph: President José Eduardo dos Santos, left, has ruled out direct talks with the rebel leader, Jonas Savimbi, saying that previous negotiations with him were fruitless. Mr. Savimbi's rebel group, Unita, has called for peace talks in recent months and has mounted a series of attacks to prove it remains a force to be reckoned with. Angola celebrates 26 years of independence this month but the country has been racked by civil war, with few breaks for peace, since winning its independence from Portugal in 1975. Rachel L. Swarns (NYT)
